learning_outcomes.description: apply knowledge of specific mental illnesses and mental health service delivery to demonstrate a client or woman centered approach when engaging with people experiencing mental health issues.
apply the principles of recovery and evidence-based approaches to mental health promotion, early intervention, and illness management across the lifespan, including in the perinatal period.
explain the role of the multidisciplinary team and the values, ethical standards, professional and legal responsibilities, and theoretical frameworks that underpin mental health service.

demonstrate the capacity to plan and deliver recovery-oriented care in a simulated environment that addresses the needs of people with mental health concerns, across the lifespan and in a variety of settings.
describe the differing practice issues in mental health services across diverse cultural population groups, including Aboriginal and or Torres Strait Islander peoples.

assessments.task_description:
An Inspera-based quiz covering course content from weeks 1-3 will be made available from 6:00pm 15 August until 6:00pm 18 August. The quiz will consist 15 multiple choice questions and will require students to instal the UQ Inspera secure browser onto their device.

30 minutes available once the quiz has commenced.

The quiz is "open-book".
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

learning_activities.topic:
Introduction. Definitions and models of mental health & illness

Reading for this week:

Hungerford, C., Hodgson, D., Clancy, R., Murphy, G., Doyle, K., Bernoth, M., Cleary, M. (2024). Mental health care: An introduction for health professionals (5th ed.). Wiley. Chapter 1.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05
learning_activities.topic_title: Introduction. Definitions and models of mental health & illness
learning_activities.topic_description: Introduction. Definitions and models of mental health & illness Reading for this week : Hungerford, C., Hodgson, D., Clancy, R., Murphy, G., Doyle, K., Bernoth, M., Cleary, M. (2024). Mental health care: An introduction for health professionals (5th ed.). Wiley. Chapter 1 .

learning_activities.topic:
Classifying diagnoses - using and understanding DSM-5

Reading for this week:

Bland, R., Drake, G., Drayton, J. (2021). Social work practice in mental health: An introduction (3rd ed.). Routledge. Chapter 3.

Two additional readings are fundamental for this topic and the course as a whole. Neither is long, and the content of both is assessable:

Anthony, W. A. (1993). Recovery from mental illness: The guiding vision of the mental health service system in the 1990s. Psychiatric Rehabilitation Journal, 16(4), pp. 11-23.

Deegan, P. E. (1988). Recovery: The lived experience of rehabilitation. Psychiatric Rehabilitation Journal, 11(4), pp. 11-19.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Classifying diagnoses - using and understanding DSM-5 Reading for this week : Bland, R., Drake, G., Drayton, J. (2021). Neither is long, and the content of both is assessable : Anthony, W. A. (1993). Recovery from mental illness: The guiding vision of the mental health service system in the 1990s. Psychiatric Rehabilitation Journal, 16 (4), pp. 11-23. Deegan, P. E. (1988). Recovery: The lived experience of rehabilitation. Psychiatric Rehabilitation Journal, 11 (4), pp. 11-19.
